clinical_study.brief_title: Exercise and Overnight Motor Sequence Task
clinical_study.official_title: 12-week Aerobic-Anaerobic Transition Exercise Intervention and Overnight Sleep-dependent Procedural Memory Consolidation in Patients With Schizophrenia

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this randomized controlled trial (RCT) is to compare the changes of the sleep-related memory functions in patients with psychosis after they have completed the 12-week high-intensity exercise intervention, the 12-week low-intensity exercise intervention, or the 12-week controlled non-exercise intervention respectively. Fifty-one patients with psychosis, patients who received either the high-intensity exercise or low-intensity exercise as intervention shown a significant improvement to their impaired sleep-related memory function, while those who received non-exercise intervention has no such improvement. Moreover, high-intensity exercise may have a more prominent effect compare to low-intensity exercise.

primary_outcome.measure: The sleep-dependent procedural memory consolidation after 12 weeks of intervention
primary_outcome.description: Tested by comparing the finger-tapping motor sequence task performance between the three groups during the 12-week follow-up assessment.

secondary_outcome.measure: The verbal memory consolidation after 12 weeks of intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Tested by comparing the logical memory task performance between the three groups during the 12-week follow-up assessment

secondary_outcome.measure: The attention performance after 12 weeks of intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by using the cancellation task performance and compare between the three groups during the 12-week follow-up assessment

secondary_outcome.measure: The sleep quality after 12 weeks of intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by using the Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index (PSQI) and compare the differences between the three groups during the 12-week follow-up assessment

secondary_outcome.measure: The insomnia severity after 12 weeks of intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by using the Insomnia Severity Index (ISI) and compare the differences between the three groups during the 12-week follow-up assessment

arm_group.description: This group of subjects will receive 2-3 sessions of high-intensity cycling exercise training per week, for a total of 12 weeks. The exercise the subjects received will interchange between the aerobic and anaerobic state.
This group of subjects will receive 2-3 sessions of low-intensity cycling exercise training per week, for a total of 12 weeks. The exercise the subjects received will maintain at an aerobic level.

This group of subjects will receive 2-3 sessions of psycho-education class per week, for a total of 12 weeks. The content of the class includes non-exercise related psycho-education content to participants (e.g., food hygiene, psychological well being, food nutrition, etc).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Aged from 18 to 55
- Based on the SCID diagnosed to have schizophrenia and related psychotic disorders
- Ability to understand the nature of the study and to give written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Severe physical illness (Myocardial Infarction, Hypertension, Fracture, Spinal problems in which exercise may be contraindicated), and seizure disorders
- Comorbid substance dependence
- Unstable psychotic symptoms
- A history of brain trauma or organic brain disease
- Known history of intellectual disability or special school attendance
- Answered one or more "yes" in the PAR-Q and without doctors approval for exercise
